Thanks.

comments.author: Kryptowerk
comments.body: Quote from: Zoec on February 19, 2023, 02:54:53 PMCheck price Lealana please.Not sure what you mean. Why should I check the price for Lealana? You mean the 4-coin set?If you want to make an offer, send me a dm!

comments.author: MoparMiningLLC
comments.body: and to clarify - all Lealana are Buyer Funded - zero are funded by Smoothie - there are 2 versions of "buyer funded" one where the buyer funds the coins directly prior to the coins being shipped by Smoothie - this way Smoothie can verify they are funded prior to shipment. the second where the buyer funds the coins directly upon receipt.while there is a difference in that the first are guaranteed to be funded, at no point does smoothie fund the coins himself.

comments.author: PreciousMetapsICT
comments.body: Quote from: MoparMiningLLC on February 20, 2023, 02:16:41 AMand to clarify - all Lealana are Buyer Funded - zero are funded by Smoothie - there are 2 versions of "buyer funded" one where the buyer funds the coins directly prior to the coins being shipped by Smoothie - this way Smoothie can verify they are funded prior to shipment. the second where the buyer funds the coins directly upon receipt.while there is a difference in that the first are guaranteed to be funded, at no point does smoothie fund the coins himself. I think we just say buyer funded as that is how he sells them. 100% agree with your statement

comments.author: MoparMiningLLC
comments.body: Quote from: PreciousMetapsICT on February 20, 2023, 02:42:53 AMQuote from: MoparMiningLLC on February 20, 2023, 02:16:41 AMand to clarify - all Lealana are Buyer Funded - zero are funded by Smoothie - there are 2 versions of "buyer funded" one where the buyer funds the coins directly prior to the coins being shipped by Smoothie - this way Smoothie can verify they are funded prior to shipment. the second where the buyer funds the coins directly upon receipt.while there is a difference in that the first are guaranteed to be funded, at no point does smoothie fund the coins himself. I think we just say buyer funded as that is how he sells them. 100% agree with your statement yes - the difference is one is guaranteed to have been loaded when sold while the other not. just clarifying the "maker funded" statement.

comments.author: owlcatz
comments.body: Quote from: MoparMiningLLC on February 20, 2023, 03:02:15 AMQuote from: PreciousMetapsICT on February 20, 2023, 02:42:53 AMQuote from: MoparMiningLLC on February 20, 2023, 02:16:41 AMand to clarify - all Lealana are Buyer Funded - zero are funded by Smoothie - there are 2 versions of "buyer funded" one where the buyer funds the coins directly prior to the coins being shipped by Smoothie - this way Smoothie can verify they are funded prior to shipment. the second where the buyer funds the coins directly upon receipt.while there is a difference in that the first are guaranteed to be funded, at no point does smoothie fund the coins himself. I think we just say buyer funded as that is how he sells them. 100% agree with your statement yes - the difference is one is guaranteed to have been loaded when sold while the other not. just clarifying the "maker funded" statement.Still, in the past, like 2014-ish - Most people avoided these, and bought rolls VERY cheap in his old auctions. The funded usually went for higher ofc...The real difference is the laser-mark, let's face it.As a result of these BF coins, many people sold them on ebay and such, WITHOUT providing any sort of provenance or lists of addresses, leading to de-valuing of many of those coins over the years compared to the Non-BF lasermarked coins. The premiums have always been higher for non BF coins, but that has already changed as the lust for "Smoothie" coins continues... Both new and aftermarket/Auction sales, obviously.Get stacking fellas, as smoothie is not going to do this forever, let's face it!

comments.author: MoparMiningLLC
comments.body: perhaps so - but it is incorrect to differentiate them as "maker funded" and "buyer funded" all the coins are "buyer funded" and directly buyer funded at that. The buyer funds the coins directly - no funds are sent to smoothie and he then in turn funds the coins.I dont know about the laser marking in the past but all my current Lealanas are "buyer funded" and all have the laser addresses etched in them though a magnifying glass and bright light is needed to see it. the correct terminology is "funded" or "not funded" in reference to these coins.

comments.author: owlcatz
comments.body: Quote from: MoparMiningLLC on February 20, 2023, 03:28:53 AMperhaps so - but it is incorrect to differentiate them as "maker funded" and "buyer funded" all the coins are "buyer funded" and directly buyer funded at that. The buyer funds the coins directly - no funds are sent to smoothie and he then in turn funds the coins.I dont know about the laser marking in the past but all my current Lealanas are "buyer funded" and all have the laser addresses etched in them though a magnifying glass and bright light is needed to see it. the correct terminology is "funded" or "not funded" in reference to these coins.Well yes, this is because of Fincen, and the only way smoothie can operate legally without MSL's etc etc... The coins are differentiated by the laser-mark or not, IMO, so I guess we can agree to disagree, nothing new, cheers man!  owlEdit I'm out, glws @KW ... nice selection!

The coins are differentiated by the laser-mark or not, IMO, so I guess we can agree to disagree, nothing new, cheers man!  owlEdit I'm out, glws @KW ... nice selection!  maybe the new "buyer funded" are now being laser marked - my holo says "buyer funded" and the coins were not funded prior to shipping but the coins do have the addresses lasered on them.
